channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The proposed detour to allow council to upgrade the Jim Soorley Bikeway bridge would have put cyclists on Nudgee Road for five kilometres.
item.title: Council makes U-turn on north Brisbane bikeway bridge detour

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: So who are they and why were they chosen?
item.title: Queensland has a new deputy premier and treasurer: who are they?

item.description: In about week two of isolation, my dog Miss Maudie started looking at me like I’d completely lost my mind.
item.title: Life in isolation has been just as weird for our pets. Just ask my dog

item.description: Suresh Raina has urged India to soften its stance on releasing players to foreign Twenty20 competitions, such as the Big Bash League.
item.title: Let them play: Raina makes case for Indians to compete in foreign franchises

item.description: Sydney living with Coronavirus - May 8, 2020
item.title: Sydney living with Coronavirus - May 8, 2020

item.description: A visual record of this week in Sydney under COVID-19
item.title: Sydney living with Coronavirus - April 10, 2020

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Groups of 100 leaving the ship were not compelled to follow new federal government rules to keep 1.5 metre distancing between them, Carnival executive says,
item.title: Disembarking Ruby Princess passengers not told to socially distance, inquiry told

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Daniel Andrews to ease COVID-19 restrictions on Victoria from Wednesday as NSW, QLD students return to classrooms, Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Daniel Andrews eases Victorian restrictions as global COVID-19 cases surpass 4 million, Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Fernando Farias, 44, was located at an Atlantis Avenue home in Cooloola Cove last Wednesday during a police welfare check.
item.title: Man found in coast home could have been dead for 'number of weeks'

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: groups of students head back to school after restrictions eased over the weekend

item.description: The suspension of the AFL season came at a good time for both the forward duo, both of whom missed the Swans' round-one win over Adelaide.
item.title: Franklin ready, Reid in the mix as Swans prepare for AFL restart

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The PM has denied misleading Parliament over his part in a sports funding program after documents revealed his office sought authority over the approved projects.
item.title: Morrison denies misleading Parliament over $100m sports grants

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Former North Melbourne coach Dean Laidley is accused of possessing the drug ice and sending a woman dozens of aggressive phone calls and text messages, court told.
item.title: Dean Laidley 'bombarded' woman with aggressive messages, court hears

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: International Melbourne Cup contenders should be forced to race once in Australia before competing in the classic race, according to former Victorian racing minister Denis Napthine.
item.title: 'Local' Melbourne Cup could recapture public imagination: Napthine

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: An infectious disease expert says all states bar Western Australia have been convinced the AFL's return-to-plan plan is safe and has accused the government of playing hard ball over the league's strict COVID-19 testing protocols.
item.title: AFL health expert says WA government plays hard ball over testing regime

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: Chief political correspondent David Crowe joins national editor Tory Maguire to discuss the return to parliamentary sitting.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: pollies back to work

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Richard Pusey allegedly sent messages to a friend a month before the Eastern Freeway collision, saying he'd reached speeds of 300km/h on the same road.
item.title: Porsche driver bragged to a mate about driving at 300km/h, court hears

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The boy entered cardiac arrest after hitting his head following a fall.
item.title: Boy in critical condition after fall at Sydney primary school

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The NSW chief medical officer has encouraged all players to be vaccinated but says those who refuse would not cause the issues they have in Queensland.
item.title: Players refusing shot won't hinder NRL restart in NSW, says Chant

item.dc:creator: Steve Meacham
item.description: Father Peter Grice was a meek, modest parish priest but there was another, quite unexpected side to him.
item.title: Private passion of a modest priest

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Qantas has pushed back aircraft deliveries from Airbus and Boeing worth hundreds of millions of dollars as it rethinks its network and fleet needs during a long recovery from the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Qantas pauses Boeing, Airbus plane deliveries amid COVID-19 downturn

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: “Increased drinking by people worried about COVID-19 might be good news for alcohol industry executives, but it’s certainly worrying news for our community’s health.”
item.title: 'In harm's way': The pandemic drug use that most concerns one WA rehab facility

item.description: While Formula One rivals compete in virtual grands prix and various esports series during the COVID-19 lockdown, six-time world champion Lewis Hamilton has been busy racing against himself.
item.title: Lewis Hamilton has only himself to beat online

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: It was also the first time the students wore their senior jerseys, which staff personally delivered to their houses.
item.title: Brisbane school welcomes Year 12 students back with guard of honour

item.description: Cubby House Rock is keeping music teacher Danniel Smith afloat after his weekly roster fell from 300 kids to just 40.
item.title: This enterprising papa runs Zoom music lessons from a cubby house

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The 27 senators and House of Representatives members said that China had made "deeply disturbing" threats to punish Australia.
item.title: 'We back our Aussie mates': US Congress members slam China threats

item.description: Only a New Yorker could love the screech of a subway train. But the public library put it on a new album for those missing the sounds of the busy city.
item.title: Press play to hear the NYC that used to be

item.description: Arbery was shot and killed February 23 but no arrests were made until this month after national outrage over the case swelled.
item.title: Georgia requests federal probe in handling of Ahmaud Arbery case

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: You can have five people visit your home, go to the hairdresser, go fishing and play golf. Here's a guide to the new rules in Victoria.
item.title: Victoria's new coronavirus restrictions: What you can do and where you can go

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: It is almost impossible to understand the havoc the coronavirus is wreaking in real economies and the renewed bullishness in sharemarkets.
item.title: Disconnect: Sharemarkets are ignoring the economic devastation the pandemic is wreaking

item.description: Michael Zammit Tabona wrote in a Facebook post on Friday "75 years ago we stopped Hitler. Who will stop Angela Merkel?"
item.title: Malta envoy to Finland resigns after comparing Merkel to Hitler

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Another cold front is due to arrive towards the end of the week, bringing a potential shower and storm activity with it.
item.title: Temperatures hit 1 degree in Queensland's Darling Downs, Granite Belt

item.dc:creator: John Bailey
item.description: John Harlan Kim is one of the many expat Australian actors who moved to Los Angeles to pursue the Hollywood dream. To them, lockdown is business as usual.
item.title: Marking time amid the Dream Factory's restless slumber

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: Opera Australia has announced another round of cancellations and postponements as the coronavirus pandemic continues to devastate the arts sector.
item.title: Opera Australia scratches entire winter season

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Melbourne had been forced to train in Albury last week due to tough coronavirus restrictions in their home state.
item.title: Storm plan AAMI Park return as Victoria gives green light

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: A Brisbane engineering company has transformed 10 shipping containers into portable hospital rooms that trap infected air inside.
item.title: Brisbane firm builds portable COVID-19 rooms in case second wave emerges

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: AFL clubs will have to wait for the league to give the green light for them to resume training, despite the Andrews government lifting some restrictions on sport and opening the way for a return in Victoria.
item.title: Victoria loosens restrictions, but clubs wait for AFL green light on training

item.description: Changes to remote learning are widely expected to be part of the announcement, as are changes to the limit on group gatherings and home visits.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: As devastating as the downturn has already been, the future looks even worse.
item.title: Bleeding money: Savaged US airlines facing a bleak future

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Contact-tracing teams have been at the forefront of the state's public health response to COVID-19, and their job is far from over.
item.title: The 'disease detectives' working behind the scenes to reopen Queensland

item.description: The late Jack Mundey is remembered as a firebrand union leader and environmental activist. 50 years ago, the Herald met him for the first time.
item.title: From the Archives, 1970: 'He labours for striking labourers'

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Victorians will be allowed to have five visitors in their homes, under an easing of the state's lockdown restrictions, Premier Daniel Andrews has announced.
item.title: Five guests in your home: Victorian restrictions eased

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: The women were all walking home from inner-city pubs in Richmond and Fitzroy in 2017 and 2018 when they were offered a lift home by an unknown man.
item.title: Man arrested over inner-city sexual assaults on women walking home

item.description: The self-proclaimed "architect of rock 'n' roll" died on the weekend aged 87.
item.title: The essential Little Richard playlist

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: Jack Mundey, Builders' Labourers Federation leader and Australian Communist Party member, has died. He was 90.
item.title: Union leader Jack Mundey dies aged 90

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: The state government is increasing COVID-19 testing at prisons across Victoria, after the Supreme Court ruled authorities had seemingly failed in their duty of care to protect a prisoner from coronavirus.
item.title: COVID-19 testing rolled out to prisoners and prison staff

item.description: On May 12, 1949, the Russian blockade of Berlin lifted. Lasting almost a full year, the blockade was one of the first major international crisis of the Cold War.
item.title: From the Archives, 1949: The Berlin Blockade is lifted

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: A man in a white Holden ute travelling to the Victorian town of Dollar became lost and asked for directions. Police are now looking for that car.
item.title: Police search for ute connected to $3.9 million gold heist
